channel.title: Unlimited special command
channel.description:
Hey guys I'm new to this scene but eehh, I tried to make the command and I get this error which I cant solve I hope y'all can help me. I'm using trisidiax V3
[img]http://img837.imageshack.us/img837/4926/v9i4.png[/img]

item.title: Unlimited special command
item.dc:creator: @BrandonRSPS BrandonRSPS
item.description:
@BrandonRSPS wrote:

[quote=“Pure_, post:3, topic:543771”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=662649.msg4428831#msg4428831 date=1402230996]
You didn’t set that command up right at all…
The variable for the command isn’t “Command”. If you look below your command you added, you’d see it’s actually "playerCommand"
Next, the startsWith method requires you to have a String to check.
so it’d look like:
if(playerCommand.startsWith(“tashnak”))

Next, to check player rights, you need to add the client object first because playerRights is per instance.
if(playerCommand.startsWith(“tashnak”) && c.playerRights == 3) {

^Should be what you’re looking for.
[/quote]I doubt he understood any of this, considering his issue and your wording.

OP go read about java, there’s no real way to help you with this except by spoonfeeding.[/quote]

I read it just fine, although, I’ve had experience with codscript which also uses the C syntaxing so you actually could be right…

Read full topic

item.title: Unlimited special command
item.dc:creator: @pure2ownage Pure_
item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:2, topic:543771”]You didn’t set that command up right at all…
The variable for the command isn’t “Command”. If you look below your command you added, you’d see it’s actually "playerCommand"
Next, the startsWith method requires you to have a String to check.
so it’d look like:
if(playerCommand.startsWith(“tashnak”))

Next, to check player rights, you need to add the client object first because playerRights is per instance.
if(playerCommand.startsWith(“tashnak”) && c.playerRights == 3) {

^Should be what you’re looking for.[/quote]I doubt he understood any of this, considering his issue and your wording.

OP go read about java, there’s no real way to help you with this except by spoonfeeding.

Read full topic

item.title: Unlimited special command
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

You didn’t set that command up right at all…
The variable for the command isn’t “Command”. If you look below your command you added, you’d see it’s actually "playerCommand"
Next, the startsWith method requires you to have a String to check.
so it’d look like:
if(playerCommand.startsWith(“tashnak”))

Next, to check player rights, you need to add the client object first because playerRights is per instance.
if(playerCommand.startsWith(“tashnak”) && c.playerRights == 3) {

^Should be what you’re looking for.

Read full topic
